text: measures compile time. Zygote's biggest problem at higher order is that it takes forever to compile

elements.text: measures compile time. Zygote's biggest problem at higher order is that it takes forever to compile

text:
fwiw, I think it still will get the compile time measurement without `eval`, at least on 1.6:
```julia> @time cos'''(1.0)
108.822708 seconds (87.97 M allocations: 4.930 GiB, 1.52% gc time, 99.84% compilation time)
0.8414709848078965

julia> @time cos'''(1.0)
  0.006620 seconds (4.99 k allocations: 2.125 MiB)
0.8414709848078965

julia> @time cos'''(1.0)
  0.006381 seconds (4.99 k allocations: 2.125 MiB)
0.8414709848078965```
might also be different in Diffractor

text: Now that you say that, I definitely do remember at least one time where I felt like `@time` was lying to me about compile time. I could tell it was taking almost a second to compile, but reported like a microsecond

text: using `@eval`  to block it makes sense
